result.execSummary:
The defendant Colton J. Zarecki was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Pay restitution of $767.96 plus the surcharge. 
If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

Continue with alcohol program. 
Apologize to Brad Blenker and Scott Bergman.
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations, if he hasn't done so.

timeConds.notes:
Stayed at the agents discretion.
7/30/15 Amended per Stipulation and Order: Defendant is eligible for Electronic Monitoring for his jail sentence upon approval by the Sheriff's Office.  /s/JVF 7/27/15
Consecutive to:

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Colton J. Zarecki

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Receipt 17R 007755
from Defendant re: payments made to Probation Agent
to amend judgment of conviction /s/ JVF 07/27/15

Defendant Colton J. Zarecki in court with attorney Anne Renc. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 14CF403, 15CF23, 15CF50
9:04 a.m.  Court calls the case. 

State files amended information in 14CF403.
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
14CF403 Counts 1 thru 4 of the amended information - GUILTY
15CF23 Counts 2 & 3 - GUILTY

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 14CF403 Counts 1 thru 4, 15CF23 Counts 2 & 3.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
15CF50 is dismissed and read-in. 
15CF23 Count 1 is dismissed and read-in. 

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Renc makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
14CF403 Counts 1 & 2:
Sentence withheld.
24 months probation
Continue with alcohol program. 
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations, if he hasn't done so.
Absolute sobriety including controlled substances. 
Maintain employment. 
Apologize to Brad Blenker and Scott Bergman.
Pay restitution of $767.96 plus the surcharge.
Pay costs.
60 days conditional jail time, consecutive, Stayed at agents discretion. 

14CF403 Counts 3 & 4:
90 days jail on each count, concurrent
Court finds defendant eligible for huber. 

15CF23 Counts 2- 
6 months jail - Stayed
Court finds defendant eligible for huber.
24 months probation, concurrent:
Same conditions as 14CF403 Counts 1 & 2

Count 3 
30 days jail concurrent - Stayed
Court finds defendant eligible for huber.
24 months probation, concurrent:
Same conditions as 14CF403 Counts 1 & 2

Bonds to be applied to restitution.  Any balance will be applied to the fines and costs.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 07-21-2015 09:00 am
Defendant Record Update
Pre-trial conference on March 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on February 23, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 18, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on January 12, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Colton J. Zarecki in court with attorney Anne Renc. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.

Court amends the information with the correct address of the defendant.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 12, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Prior: W55 N230-1 Woodmere Court, Cedarburg, WI 53012 United States
Preliminary hearing on November 24, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Colton J. Zarecki in court with attorney Anne Renc. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 24, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Atty Renc

ADDRESS INFO for Colton J. Zarecki
Current: W55 N230-1 Woodmere Court, Cedarburg, WI 53012 United States  (Effective: 10-22-2014)
Prior: 1910 Monroe Street, Stevens Point, WI 54481

Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places: Scott Bergman or Brad Blenker or any premises they are upon. 
Report alcohol and drug free to the Day Report Center no less than the following times per week:  *On any Court Date.

ADA David Knaapen appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Knaapen states facts for anticipated charges of Battery/Substantial Battery.
Court advises defendant of right to make a statement/remain silent. 
Defendant indicates he would like to speak with the people he was with last night before stating anything.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a $5,000 signature bond with conditions as stated.
Defendant asks to apologize to the people he hurt. 

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:   11/03/2014 @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 1
